instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7050: What is R7050? Current sense shunt resistor for the battery, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 17/18 on ISL6259 should give you 2.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: ​<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - a
threads.message:
Before i don't get Green Light, i find out i had short to ground on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR>. 
I replaced and i get Green Light, Fan Spin without <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR>.
If i put back <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR> (new), i get 4v in F7040, green light but won't turn on because that.

threads.title: ​<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - a
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/52 and traces to ISL ok? <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> ok? Resistance to GND on PPBUS?

threads.title: ​<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - a
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/52 also 05 is ok.
Gnd on ppbus is 4.47 mΩ [h=3][/h]

threads.title: ​<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - a
threads.message: What is 4.47mOhm? That is milli which is pretty much a short. This is getting kinda annoying, I still cannot trust your measurements.

​<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - a
threads.message: Capital M would be Mega and m would be milli, but who the fucks knows, probably measured with power applied.

I'm not stupid. Of course i measured with NO POWER.
Yes, show me in M (capital)
